title: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
Wikipedia:


TRIVIA:

[...]

At various points in the second episode, there are rooms that contain an "Elder Yorp," who will give you hints for the rest of the game. They are positioned so that it is very difficult to get past without touching them. However, many players figured out that you could barely jump over them without touching, thus avoiding the dialog bits that interrupt gameplay. This type of jump is sometimes called a "Yorp-jump", a term used to refer to similar annoyance-avoiding jumps in other games.

[hr][/quote]
I thought they were Vorticon Elders? Were there any Yorps in Commander Keen 2... Or were they talking about the metal guys in Commander Keen 1, and the 'second episode' was the error?


(Which then leads to the question of what are those weird metal things on CK1.)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commander_Keen_series]The article[/url]
The Yorps (and Garg) are of course in Keen 1.
Hmmm, they're not named "elders" either, so it's not a simple typo, somebody that added that mixed up K1 and K2.
K2 has Vorticons in stasis fields... those things never quite made sense to me; why are they there?
(Nothing similar in K3 that I can remember.)

I never heard of a "Yorp-jump" either, not in Keen, let alone in other games with "similar annoyance-avoiding jumps".
I don't recall being able to jump over the statues in K1, or the stasis fields in K2 hard at all either.
If you ask me, that whole piece of trivia needs some deleting or at least editing/trimming.

Oh, and which metal things are you referring to?Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
I can't remember if you can jump over every yorp statue, but at least some of them. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
[hr]Retodon8 K2 has Vorticons in stasis fields... those things never quite made sense to me; why are they there?
[hr]I always figured their mental willpower was too strong for the mind belts, so they were put in stasis to be kept out of the way.

title: Re: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
Either that or they were of no use, being so old.


But anyways, thanks... Yeah, I was wondering about that entry.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Wiki error or something I missed?
content:
Agree with Spleen, there surely was something like that behind it. Otherwise Mortimer could have just flung them out to space via some ship airlock in case he didn't need the elder vorticons. But, why didn't he do it? He could've easily commanded the younger vorticons to do it. Perhaps the elder were too strong to be get rid of completely.

PS. To begin with, one shouldn't assume Wikipedia information is correct.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Yeah...
content: I'm going to delete that erronious information.  If anyone wants to put it back up, they're welcome to correct it (Just copy and paste the quote at the beginning of this thread.)

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Wikipedia keeps every version of every article stored, so one can easily take stuff from the previous version if one wants to. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
I say just change the typo.


[quote]Quote:[hr] I can't remember if you can jump over every yorp statue, but at least some of them.[hr][/quote]

All of em, believe me. Also, you can avoid the two elders easily.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Agree with Spleen, there surely was something like that behind it. Otherwise Mortimer could have just flung them out to space via some ship airlock in case he didn't need the elder vorticons. But, why didn't he do it? He could've easily commanded the younger vorticons to do it. Perhaps the elder were too strong to be get rid of completely.[hr][/quote]

Well, notice how there were only two elders? And that despite there being children and a nursery, there were no vortimoms? When the ship was captured the women, elders and catchable kids were thrown into space. However, many of the younger children were to fast to be caught, and were left to run around the ship until they starved, got shot or got killed. The only two surviving elders were kept because they were the only ones who had visited Earth beforehand [Many, amny years ago as part of the first exploratory mission, a minor mishap lead to them starting the furry movement accidentally] Since the mind belts can kill too frail a body [note, no elders in Keen 3, all were killed by the belts] Mort had to have them locked in stasis fields.
A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
LevelLord:

Well, notice how there were only two elders? And that despite there being children and a nursery, there were no vortimoms? When the ship was captured the women, elders and catchable kids were thrown into space.
[hr][/quote]

Not likely. It was a military vessel, not a colony ship. How many moms and kids do you hear about being on a military destroyer ship?

[quote]Quote:[hr]
However, many of the younger children were to fast to be caught, and were left to run around the ship until they starved, got shot or got killed. The only two surviving elders were kept because they were the only ones who had visited Earth beforehand [Many, amny years ago as part of the first exploratory mission, a minor mishap lead to them starting the furry movement accidentally] Since the mind belts can kill too frail a body [note, no elders in Keen 3, all were killed by the belts] Mort had to have them locked in stasis fields.
[hr][/quote]

Or they were kept on planet Vorticon X, a lovely vacationing spot for members of the VARP (Vorticon Association of Elderly Peoples).~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Hmmm, that's interesting point indeed.. It was a Vorticon mothership (no vortimoms included) that definitely seemed to be quite militaristic.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Not likely. It was a military vessel, not a colony ship. How many moms and kids do you hear about being on a military destroyer ship?[hr][/quote]

Yet oddly, there were kids there, how odd. Obviously you need to Keen more, since you seem to have forgotten this.

Besides, check the map; there are clearly marked levels marked 'Home A' and 'Home B' on the map [Levels 8 and 10] These levels are especially rich in vortikids.

This is a translated picture of level 10's location.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/keenedit_000.png[/img]

Besides, the Vortiship wasn't primarily a military vessel; why on earth would a race like the vorticons want to spend such a vast amount of money and rescources on a ship soley to destroy a planet they'd never heard of? No; before its conversion it was indeed a VARP vessel.
A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Okay... You are aware that quarters are necessary for soliders right? Home A and Home B are nothing more than the living quarters for Vorticons and their 'would have been' cadets.

Remember, Vorticons could be like spartans, training their children at young ages.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Yeah...
content:
Considering the elders said that the vorticons were 'peaceful' I just don't know. I think the vast amount of candy present is evidence against it, but we may never know the truth.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
